ch.aplu.android.bluetooth
Class BluetoothServer

java.lang.Object
  ch.aplu.android.bluetooth.BluetoothServer

public class BluetoothServer
extends java.lang.Object

Class to create a client that connects to a server via Bluetooth. Keep in mind that a server must be up and running before any client can connect.

Constructor Summary

Constructor Detail

BluetoothServer

public BluetoothServer(android.bluetooth.BluetoothAdapter adapter,
                       java.lang.String serviceName,
                       BluetoothServerListener listener)
Creates a BluetoothServer instance, registers the given BluetoothServerListener and starts a server thread that waits for an incomming client connection request. The standard RFCOMM UUID 00001101-0000-1000-8000-00805F9B34FB is used. If Bluetooth device is disabled, it is enabled now. When the server is waiting for a connection, it is discoverable, even if the discoverability is not manually turn on.

Parameters:
adapter - the BluetoothAdapter for this device
serviceName - the name of the service to install
listener - the BluetoothServerListener that gets a notification when a client connects
Method Detail

getInputStream

public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()
Returns the InputStream of the Bluetooth connection.

Returns:
InputStream or null, if not connected

getOutputStream

public java.io.OutputStream getOutputStream()
Returns the OutputStream of the Bluetooth connection.

Returns:
OutputStream or null, if not connected

getSocket

public android.bluetooth.BluetoothSocket getSocket()
Returns the Bluetooth socket of the current connection.

Returns:
Bluetooth socket or null, if not connected

abort

public void abort()
Closes open streams and the server socket. Terminates a blocking ServerSocket.accept() and releases all resources. This instance of BluetoothServer may not be used any more.
